newsitem.title: UK: Safeway sales up 3.7 pct as yr profits rise.
newsitem.headline: Safeway sales up 3.7 pct as yr profits rise.

text.p: British supermarket group Safeway Plc said on Wednesday that same store sales were up 3.7 percent in the first six weeks of the current year with prices down 0.9 percent.

It said pre-tax profits before exceptionals were 430 million pounds ($701.5 million), with an underlying figure of 421 million, up seven percent, and paid out a total dividend of 14.10 pence per share, up 11 percent.
Safeway said it planned to create 8,000 jobs over the next two years, including the addition of 1,600 customer service and support staff this year.

Chairman David Webster said in the results statement, "We achieved our sales target of 15 pounds per square foot per week ahead of achedule, increased our market share and quickened the pace of innovation."
Chief executive Colin Smith said the group's objective this year was to achieve higher volume sales growth.
Safeway said the proportion of its customers who spend more than 40 pounds per visit rose to 18 percent from 17 percent, rrepresenting 25 percent of sales against 23.6 percent the previous year.
The company said sales and profit growth slowed in the fourth quarter, however, with negative food price inflation since January.
The results compared with market forecasts of 425 to 435 million pounds. ($ = 0.613 British Pounds)
